f3BeCT64PbTF9oOYiHAhDw.text: Good gyro.  I like the falafel as well.  He different types of fries are all good as well.  The service hasn't always been great.

g8izOFWhMRRSRpjCjJT8xA.text: Always my first choice for Greek Lunch.. love their fries and lamb gyro.  Been going here for a few years now... Good location at blakney

I2l1cmelAyLZzD8-ne-qhg.text: Amazing service with a smile. Very fresh and clean flavors all around! Love this little gem!

P9wBSh9Yjyi6wJlwSPOiCw.text: Friendly staff, great fries but the gyros was not good.   I've been searching for a delicious authentic style gyro for a while and its not here. I've ate at enough Greek restaurants and gyro food trucks up north to know the difference. I was expecting my gyro to be prepared a certain way. Unfortunately, the lamb meat was cooked on a flat grill and it doesn't taste the same to me. If a restaurant is going to use a flat grill to "warm up" the meat versus cooking it on a spinning griller. I can simply cook my own gyro at home. It taste better when the meat is cooked and sliced on the grill spinner.    Where are the restaurants that cook the gyro meat on the spinning griller??

FxXOXy70CjSIjmTBrbtojQ.text: Great food but the people who work there are either very loud, very rude or just don't care.  I'd rate it a 5 except for their attitude!

ENHR1ns9rFajfOFzbcHxnw.text: Excellent food but experience ruined by staff cleaning floor while I was eat 20 mins before closing. The bleach smell ruined the food aroma and the kids working were clearly just trying to close early vs. offering good customer service. The phone rang 10x before someone answered -staring at the phone saying I will answer if they keep calling- they didn't want to make more food close to closing time. They locked the front door 10 mins before closing as well. I'm writing this bc if I were management I would want to know what my employees are doing when I'm not looking. Hopefully you can hire more customer focused staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cleaning floor while I was eating 20 mins before closing. Disgusting bleach smell while eating dinner.

-l_sba2MjYZ0S9eBzG5ZTA.text: Delicious and great price! Definitely a nice option in an otherwise expensive shopping center

KjMVHJyWD_oZvkS-yWGm3g.text: Delicious.  I always forget about this place but once I remember I want it for like 4 days straight :)  Hummus is amazing  Gyro is amazing  Chicken is amazing  Spicy fries amazing  Yum yum oh and adorable

fuO7lG5HQtlJGdygXxzyDA.text: I travel a LOT! On my travels I always eat at whats rated as "the best" whatever ethnic restaurant I can find in the city. I cross tab the 4 sites I use and I SERIOUSLY count on the reviews so I take time to write honest non-biased reviews. I always try the local Thai, Pho and Greek. So when I found Greco fresh years ago I fell in love with it. Let me explain. There are dozens of Greek/Mediterranean restaurants in every city. Seems Greeks love the food biz.  If you like an awesome quick-service Greek anytime of day then you'll LOVE Greco. I promise! Give it a try. It ROCKS! THIS IS NOT A FAST FOOD RESTAURANT!!! First of all Mia is very friendly. But what makes the place a favorite of mine is the fresh ingredients in each dish. The Greek Salad is perfect with JUST the right amount of oil and vinegar. The Feta is amazing! Perfectly slightly brined JUST like I like it. The olives are authentic, not some bland olives bought at Walmart. Do yourself a favor...try the Salmon Pita. And if you're not watching what you eat...HECK, even if you are, try the lemon oregano fries. You can't eat just 1!!! I've been to 3 of the Greco's and the food is always perfect and brings me back time and time again.

59F47hmADVQ9VGME8wtPfQ.text: This place is great.  Awesome gyros and great atmosphere.  My favorite is the fries.  They are great fries without the added spices.  The added spices make them unique.

Uk18J4fUcCibaRGnnvW2Kw.text: Visiting from Baltimore and stopped in for lunch.  Had a gyro and fries which were outstanding.   The lemon basil fries were crispy and very tasty and the gyro is the best I've ever had!

y2cwshtmqACib1linRV0ww.text: Fast food Greek food.  Food and service was good.  We had Greek chicken salad, traditional gyro, dolmas, and falafel.  Salad and gyro portion and taste as expected.  Falafel appetizer was lacking a little flavor, but the takizzi  sauce makes it all better. Dolmas good flavor, but was all rice. Didn't see any meat in it.

1bSGMQyjvNna7e9BA9tsaw.text: I've gone to this restaurant for the last time. I ordered the gyros platter and when served there were four rather smallish pieces of gyros. When I brought this to the attention of the server she stated that's all we're supposed to serve on the Platter. She could care less about her poor customer service. I nicely asked for the manager, and the response was he wasn't available.  Well, I didn't get mad, and replied that I would take my business elsewhere.

xREjaZW1i2r3lsqdS0aU9A.text: Amazing Greek food. Fresh, top quality and authentic. My friend recommended this place and I went back the next day. Decent portions for the price!

35AkJpe3vLABNnwu2oVgWw.text: We love this place! I always get the lamb gyro wrapped in lettuce instead of the pita bread. Low carb, gluten free and totally delicious. Hummus is top notch too and they will serve with cucumbers! Casual atmosphere that is fast and friendly. Highly recommend!

38M7IhN93QFyJ77WhfjgmQ.text: Greek salad with chicken was ok. Chicken was not a whole breast but pieces from a bag. Not marinated and not as flavorful as Akropolis at Arboretum. But liked the feta chunks. I also found a short black hair on my pita slices so I didn't eat the pita.

wziAZ8BOBnKvHh23QWczvw.text: Walked in on a weekday afternoon to give this place a second try. I ordered a meal that came with one chicken kebab and fries. My order was to-go and when I opened the box to eat my good, I was quite disappointed to taste the bed of fries to be all burnt. These were surely the worst fries i have ever had in my life. Not sure how this place gets an award for the best fries. If it were to me I would give them the award for the worst and burnt fries.

AoQuzK3O9ZhPEbbn129k1Q.text: I have eaten here many times and have always been happy with the service and the food taste and quality. Today, June 28, the issue was with the fan in the kitchen. The smoke and grease was thick inside the restaurant. We tried to eat inside but couldn't handle the air quality. We went outside and sat in the 90+ heat. Not ideal. When we got home both my kids and I had to change our clothes they smelled so badly. Please get the kitchen fan working again or I will not be able to enjoy this restaurant.

XOmPtnLJx-5ESL-6tIkWuQ.text: We really like this place.  The food comes out quickly and tastes fresh. The price works well for us.  I really like the Greek salad.

UsHzcbtnbPctM5k_Vw2azg.text: Stopped in for a fresh gyro and it was excellent. I had a seat at the bar where I could see into the kitchen and watch the magic happen. Very clean, very efficient organized process going on here.  My gyro didn't take long to be cooked and assembled. Nice thick pieces of lamb and the tzatziki was excellent. Only slightly messy, which it's kind of supposed to be. Delicious!  Cute little restaurant. Not quite first date material but certainly great for a meet up.

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyro at Greco Fresh Grille
Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greco Fresh Grille in Blakeney Shopping Plaza

4kntgtMDv8c927d_ZJ1KHQ.text: Chicken gyro combo with lemon oregano fries is the bomb. Also accept Ballantyne corporate card.

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

RDLGrbdP4TZoeQ8GBXvAjQ.text: Five Guys doesn't sit well with me after I eat it, so whenever my friends go there, I go next door to Greco and we eat outside at a connected patio.    I've never had a bad experience here.  It's as simple as can be -- you look at their huge menu as you walk in, order at the counter, and they bring their food to you.  There are pretty good options, although I always get one of their Gyros.  I prefer Chicken to Traditional (lamb), but both are good.  Also, you can make it a combo for about $3 extra. I've gotten their hummus and pita, which was delicious, but I really dig their fries.  They've got 4 flavors -- lemon oregano, cumin and garlic, sea salt, and spicy.  My favorite?  The spicy.  I really want to try their grape leaves next time.  I could go on about the food, but their service is fantastic too.  They're friendly, make good recommendations and serve you with smiles on their faces.  All this makes for a 5-star experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken gyro with spicy fries

EY3HzsE6P-melNu5wTVE4w.text: This restaurant is located in the Blakeney area. We got a good parking space and came on a saturday for lunch. They weren't busy at all. Restaurant isn't large but a little narrow. Cashier answered all our questions and was very sweet.  I got the shrimp pita sandwich and spicy fries. Shrimp was delicious and cooked perfectly. The only thing I would ask for is extra red onions. Tatziki sauce went well with it. Spicy fries were good but had a lot of seasoning on it. Some people might like that, but I rather have them lightly seasoned. They also had other flavors of fries. My husband got the chicken pita sandwich and a greek salad. Salad was very fresh. Chicken was good. Very filling. Came with a lot of meat. Both of our meals came with drinks and after our 20% off coupon, it was only $18.   I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken gyro with a side Greek salad
Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp pita with spicy fries

ChEwMXlMWNV0IKfZf9HJfA.text: The gyro salad is amazing and the lamb meat is sensational!! For the salad they give you a generous portion. The meat, olives, feta, tomatoes and cucumbers are a fantastic combination. You also get pita bread with your salad, which tastes wonderfully fresh! The salad dressing is a balsamic vinaigrette that is light and tasty.   Their grape leaves appetizer is also another favorite with yummy seasoned meat. We usually get their salads to be healthy! Parking is sometimes difficult in the Blakeney area but we think the food is worth it and definitely fabulous!!

7dKu5BQOpvvqcG_DhonkRg.text: Yes! The lamb in the gyro is so good. Pairs nicely with fresh toppings and zippy tzatziki.

-pVbWpndMZ0b8_LZONuyKw.text: Excellent choice for a late lunch early dinner. The Mezza Platter is ample with soft warm pita, hummus,tzatziku dip, feta olives dolmades and spinach pie. Paired with a relaxing tall glass of Cabernet it hit the spot on a late Friday afternoon. No frills, just good food at Greco Fresh!

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

QY0ehuAwqiHPdJFQJHzoSw.text: Great chicken gyro, great fries and friendly people at the register. The tzatziki sauce is great and everything tastes fresh and delicious. Awesome little spot! I'll definitely be back. No complaints, only compliments.

Xx-x-Ym_-uHmTV7H4N43cQ.text: I love Bill and his family. I remember when they first opened and they have stayed True to who they were as a business and the quality of the food is great! I just love this place and love the food of course!

hmoOw3iIrfMXtNecAcYbmg.text: The food is great and the staff is friendly  I like this place and the spicy fries ugh begging my bf to not take me there again or I'll eat the whole place up

0ES2ft8yRoS5kuMM-A9ELw.text: Thanks to the weekly yelp e-mail last week, we decided to travel out to Greco Fresh Grille for lunch on Sunday.  My husband had the traditional gyro with lamb and I had the chicken gyro.  We split the large lemon fries.  They do not cut you short on the portion size.  The large fries were way too much for the two of us, but they were sure good!  Subtle hint of flavors, but enough to notice and have something different.  As far as the gyros go, they were some of the best we have had!  They are packed full of meat and both the lamb and chicken had some awesome seasoning/flavor to them!!  The only cons came from my husband, which I do agree with his first con - the location, great location for people in Ballantyne, but not great for us, maybe they will get another location in Rivergate.  We will come back, but it just won't be frequently.  My husbands other con, the sweet tea was not very sweet!    They have a fantastic outdoor seating area - all for the neighboring restaurants as well, but we got to bring the dog and enjoy the nice spring weather outside!   Overall, we would highly recommend this place for some flavorful Greek goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Traditional gyro, chicken gyro and large lemon fries, so yummy!
Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

3Jz_ICErC2xs702PuxcRtA.text: Their hand cut fries seasoned with lemon-oregano are crispy with the right amount of lemony taste and flavored with aromatic oregano. It''ll be better with a little less salt. The hummus , Greek salad and grape leaves are delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyros platter with lemon oregano fries, humus and pita and grape leaves @flightofthefoodie

VTQFK2_cne0t2dThMo6YjQ.text: Very good Greek food. Probably the best in the area (South Charlotte). I had the traditional gyro. My wife had the chicken gyro. Both were excellent. Employees are awesome. Friendly and quick.  Can't wait to go back!

gWHLYAPYFQQUBt66o1d4PQ.text: Love the food here.  Growing up near Tarpon Springs, FL, which has a very large Greek population, I am nostalgic and picky when it comes to Greek food.  That's why I was pleasantly surprised when we first discovered this place a few months ago. Ate there again tonight and had the chicken kabob with lemon oregano fries.  The kids had the same thing and scarfed it down.  We also had the hummus, which was creamy and tasty...almost a meal by itself.  I wish I had fasted to make more room.  Everything always taste really fresh and flavorful.  The staff and owner are also incredibly friendly.  Looking forward to the next trip.

ic0m1zrAC06H4O10FjA91Q.text: I love this place. The chicken gyro is amazing and extremely well priced. The Greek family that owns the place are so nice and welcoming. You feel like you are eating at their place.

xKo8_BCHzF4PlnzUBa3ufA.text: Awesome place. Awesome food. Casual place. Fresh food. Great staff. Try Greco fresh today!

tpCFNLorgOiOaFEqG3vpmw.text: Fries were excellent. Spinach phyllo were really good especially dipped in the tzatziki. A bit worried about longevity d/t no one else there the two times we have been.

as9jv1CGXtyGmUrC4sU2Gw.text: My husband , daughter and I were at AT&T yesterday and awfully hungry. We searched yelp of course to see what was available food wise and saw this place and it wasn't long ago we were craving some gyros with lamb.   This Place Is A Bit Small . It felt cramped with it not busy I would not want to experience it busy. We ordered 3 traditional gyros garlic cumin french fries, and lemon oregano french fries. Service was quick. We were sitting outside. And we were amazed at how phenom this food was.   The tzatziki sauce tasted identical to my homemade one. Everything was prepared in the least messy way.  And the French fries were out of this world like we've never tasted before.   We bragged about this food the entire way home and we are looking forward to going back soon

GOLhY4YfrSUorGLMGrPysw.text: Had the lamb gyros and it was super tasty (and i've tried a lot of gyros!).  I also got the spicy hummus.  Will definitely come again and owner was super friendly which is a great bonus :)

SWVQLLjVodXcUy-kyGObaw.text: Great value! I have been here twice and it is consistently awesome. (Just as wonderful as when I  ate here for dinner in May.) Both times I had the vegetarian pita. Thank you for having a hearty vegetarian choice on your menu! (Instead of always having to eat a salad when I go out) The pita was stuffed with several kinds of veggies and excellent sauce! I must say it was so delicious and filling I almost forgot it was meatless! The food is always wonderful, but what further impressed me was the temperature. I got my pita to go for lunch and I pulled it out 20 minutes later and that baby was still piping hot! Thank you for perfectly wrapping it in foil, so it was not a cold mushy mess when I finally got to eat it. If I lived in Charlotte, I would eat here every week! I dined here yesterday (09-09) and already I can't wait to go back!

vfRo7dtWtdRH6oAEo3qfDA.text: Fantastic Food, Fantastic Service, Fantastic Value!  Friendly staff, authentic food, budget friendly prices.

YHKjTQfW4FPOEo8eiWthWw.text: OK the traditional lamb gyro was excellent.  I would give it 5 stars.  I got a combo with the fancy fries.  I give the fries 2 stars.  The flavor is excellent but the texture is poor.  They are cooked for too long in oil that is not up to temp.  Too greasy, too limp.  Bump the temp of the oil up 25 degrees and shorten the cooking time just a bit.  The hummus was very good.  Not the best I've ever had but very good.  Service was pretty quick, food was hot.  Simple place. Place your order, pay, sit, wait, they bring your food, eat.  I left a small tip at the time of the order.  Price is good.

QUEsQodQTMRBgwkDXXp7nA.text: Lamb gyro and the "lemon and oregano" fries. Fresh hot and tasty.  Was a little louder than what we like, but no issues even with several children in the restaurant. I would like to see them rearrange the drink and condiments area as it is a bit cluttered and so close to the table across from it you almost bump into them if they are seated there. I think they have wi-fi if you need it. Great Greek food without waiting for the Greek festival. We will return on a regular basis.

u7gvmCfBvHZovTimPK5Qeg.text: Yum, the best Greek chicken pita around!  I either eat chicken or vegetarian, so I can only speak to those items.  The greek salad was fresh and filling.  The lemon fries are too die for, but trying to eat healthier, so I have cut back on those..even though they are tempting....the baklava is to DIE FOR!  Cinnamon flavor, not overly sweet.  If you haven't been here, you must try it!!

FKJrqAK3BVavzKpulkrcIg.text: You owe it to yourself to have the Lamb Gyro with seasoned fries. Absolutely the best around. Live music starts this weekend at Blakeney, and Greco's the perfect spot for a date, a meal with friends, or a night out for the family!

VdXRZmbH6PoKP62NpyzntA.text: Lately I have been craving Greek food and trying to find a good place that has flavorful twist to traditional Greek food. A cousin of mine told me about this place so we went and checked it out. It is located in South Charlotte, in the Blakeney shopping center. I got the grilled chicken breast gyro with cumin and garlic fries. They also offer lemon oregano fries and plain fries. The chicken is flavored well and grilled well. The chicken had a hint of lemon to it as well which mixed well with the tzatziki sauce. Inside the gyro is long cut onions, tomatoes, lettuce, tzatziki sauce and chicken. The gyro is basic and there isn't anything unique about the dish until you get to the fries. This is the first time I have ever had cumin and garlic fries. My one concern about the fries was that there was going to be too much garlic. When I bit into the fries I was very surprised, the flavors of the cumin and garlic went very well together. The garlic was not over bearing at all and I would say I was very impressed with the fries. For about $8 to $9 you can have a chicken gyro and a very generous portion of fries. I have been back and I would go back again.

5_eIc1CSAst7QgrD155t3A.text: Brst spot for a quick Greek meal in town.  Stopped in the other day with my wife and ordered the chicken gyro, garlic and cumin fries and baklava.  The food was amazingly good.  My gyro was served brimming with fresh cut seasoned chicken breast in a warm pita accompanied by red onion, lettuce, tomato and tzatziki sauce.  The fries were fresh cut and seasoned perfectly (better than the 5 guys fries next door).  The baklava was baklava...they all kinda taste the same to me, though it was still delicious.  Prices are reasonable and the place was nice and clean.  Folks in the kitchen wear disposable gloves when preparing food, which was a welcom sight.

kvMyaeQfOzY0ZfU_as9GIA.text: Fantastic and flavorful food! Very excited to have additional ethnic food options around. The owner is extremely friendly and is very keen to please his customers with any of their requests. I only had the chicken gyro which was very well seasoned and combined nicely with the warm pita and the tzatziki sauce. Love it. Will be back to try the other items.

ePAy_B33EsWGFek1If4TjA.text: Fantastic...go twice a week ...my 12 year old whose a picky eater begs me to go For chicken skewers...I love the gyro. Must go!!!!

pzcpSajYGmBbqy1_2NotHw.text: Greco Fresh Grille is absolutely excellent.  This was my second time going there and I really loved and enjoyed the food yet again.  I ate the Grilled Chicken Gyro and it was fantastic.  I loved the fries, especially with the lemon and oregano flavorings.  Delicious!  Also, I had the traditional Greek salad which was amazing!   And not to mention the baklava with or without ice cream  was outstanding either way!  Great atmosphere, nice Greek music, friendly staff and cheerful owner. Just moved here from New York and stumbled upon this wonderful restaurant and  I will definitely be back with my whole family soon!

K5Qa-KQE2RQztz5J7ze4BA.text: This is the real deal!...Fresh cooked off the grill,just like the name! I had chicken kabobs which were tender and moist.The oregano and lemon fries were off the charts and I know I'm in trouble now...Have vowed to eat them only once a week! Great service...greeted upon entering(very important to me) Owner sat and chatted with me and shared his history with me. I will be taking my foodie friends there and am so proud that this is my find! P.S. the Hummus and Tzatziki are fresh as well and incredible...Great neighborhood spot...!

M-c327ftiKkXlyYVyG9Mlg.text: Wow!!! Seriously, drop whatever your doing now and run to Greco Fresh Grille. The menu is simple; greek salads, pitas , gyros, kabobs, veggie options. I am on a bit of a health kick, so I asked if they could serve one chicken kabob with a side of grilled veggies(not on the menu). The cashier was more than accommodating,  and said it wouldn't be a problem. A few minutes later, she brought out my food.  First i took a bite of the grilled veggies They were flavorful, and not too salty. Next came the AMAZING chicken kabob. With out a doubt,  the best I've ever had, and that's coming for a girl who loves Greek food. It was tender, juicy, and seasoned to perfection with herbs/spices from the heavens.  I scarfed it down in 5 minutes! To top it all off, the owner and his staff were friendly & make you feel right at home. I will definitely be a regular at this place. It's a ten: great prices, fresh ingredients, and awesome service. I'm thrilled that I found this gem in South Charlotte! :)

TkS26EA3JUXHmPz019NhuQ.text: I just moved here a year ago (like most people) and was really hurting for falafel. Saw this place and decided to give it a go. I was so happy. Falafel was plentiful and delicious. No two balls and 5lbs of lettuce. This was 97% falafel. Sauce was amazing. Pita fresh. Asked for a cup of hummus on the side, and I got a nice sized cup too.  Service was fast and she was very sweet too.   Sadly my toddler ate half of it on me, but just as excuse to go back for another.

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Falafel
Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Falafel

Uvoa0ykAAJLDUroKtG01TQ.text: Loved this place!  I ordered the chicken kebabs and the lemon oregano fries. I would usually get a gyro but was trying to switch up my greek food palette.   I dined in and sat outside on their patio area which was nice on a sunny day. My food was out within 10 minutes.   When I say the word FLAVOR I mean it.  The kebabs were seasoned so well and the lemon oregano fries just packed flavor all over them and the fries seemed to be fresh cut as well. The portion was more than enough I dont know If I even finished all of my fries.   I will definitely be back here and excited to see they are opening one near me in the future in the steele creak area! My quick and fast greek food fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken kebabs and lemon oregano fries

hnSU9rZqY8QEMinsSjcJCA.text: I normally LOVE this restaurant, I have ever since they have opened! The staff is always lovely and the food is ALWAYS delicious, I usually order to-go once a week! I just ordered a salad today, and was mortified when I found a live maggot in my traditional Greek salad. I took a video of the maggot/worm because it was still moving around in my food. Management was very helpful at this location and they handled the problem very kindly. But sadly I will not and can not eat at this restaurant again due to these sanitary issues. I'm writing this review as a warning for others to always be cautious and check your food before you or your kids eat it! This is unacceptable as a restaurant to serve this with their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maggot salad

FnNoytVnbPP5oc1ouf_Clw.text: Greco fresh is located in blakeney near brixx  pizza, o went for lunch it wasn't too crowded and ordered the traditional gyro with lemon oregano fries I thought the fries were fresh the taziiki sauce had a great taste to it and the gyro meat was very good. I thought the prices were great for lunch. The menu had a lot of variety and it's not too formal. I would come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tradional gyro with lemon oregano fries

xaYve9hwwhhI3sC9Cx6Yjg.text: First visit. We ordered the lamb with lemon oregano fries. We thought the fries were fresh, slightly limp but we were fine with that. I like crispy tots but it's not a requirement for all fries for us. The taziki sauce was good and the lamb was very good. I thought the prices were quite fair. The menu had a lot of variety. It is an informal vibe....you order at a counter and then sit down....place. It doesn't pretend to be something else. For a solid, quick Greek meal give this place a shot.

-NDahnOMWDnvI0UUNjRQsw.text: Went here yesterday and was so disappointed. My fries were so undercooked and soggy. Also the Meat for the chicken pita wasn't seasoned well at all

v27b-ruz111DM2hzFzzIbw.text: Y'all... Ever since the closing of Greek Isles (yes, I know, I'm living in the past and I have to let it go, but I CAN'T... a favorite is a favorite forever) I have looked and looked for a place that could match them in their making of Horiatiki (a traditional peasant salad with veg but no lettuce) with salmon... Now... this place isn't perfect, but it's pretty darn close!  Beyond the salad... their gyros are incredible, and if you say the magic words "double meat" your gyro will magically have DOUBLE the meat... and it's insanely delicious!    Now, let's talk fries.  If you die before trying their lemon & oregano fries, you've done something wrong... get here and have a pile!  It's totally worth the carb spree!  Lastly - they hire the SWEETEST people who are always SO willing to go out of their way to make you feel awesome... SO - whether you eat in or take out at this little slice of Greek food heaven, you won't be sorry!  I'm so glad their near my home... Not sure what I'd do without them!

hDkYCb5EYyDUFci_pLBK0w.text: First, I love the food here. But, a 93.5 sanitation score is unacceptably low. Since their score keeps going down, I must assume management does not care about improving.

SM0HKzKIOm_mP6lMpsuVVg.text: We are big fans. The food has been excellent each time we have eaten there. We often get takeout. The gyros and the Greek salad are incredible. The service has been great each time as well.

uIqVyq37yePpMMYuI1_xlQ.text: Oh I love their pitas and lemon cumin fries. The arugula salad is also fantastic.  A neighborhood gem!

K-8-1I9KJ3bzVNlJWqrwiw.text: Service is always great! Not sure of the guys name but he took my order today for lunch and was very helpful. Food is always fresh!

GrqoKoz5j44VZ94877GNdA.text: We love Greco Fresh Grille. The service is exceptional -- so helpful in making our selections and always with a smile!! The food is amazing. We love their homemade hummus! Our favorite dishes -- and we've tried so many -- are the Lahana and Greek Salads, chicken and lamp gyros and grilled shrimp kebabs with taziki sauce. Their seasonsed fries are to die for!! Can't wait to go againnn!!

LBBde202yAwUvEpQtT_p_g.text: This is a small place but Huge on Flavor!! I was visiting my friend and she had never been here and wanted to try it. So she ordered the taziki appetizer plate. I ordered the original gyro with the lemon and oregano French fries. She had salad with chicken. It was all delicious and the French fries were out of this world. I mean by far the best French fries I ever had!! The food came quick!! Everyone was polite. I highly suggest trying this place if you like Greek Food!!

kNdqUTpkyPJq3NgkbVPWPg.text: Update: My most recent visit was fantastic and they even were able to accommodate my request to wrap my gyro in lettuce. Awesome!

p8woO7F5EebtDRamkKGlyw.text: We did our 2nd catering order with Greco Fresh for our daughters recent HS graduation and they knocked it out of the park!  The kabobs, hummus trio (incredible!), authentic Greek Peasant Salad, amazing home made baklava,  fresh homemade tzatziki sauce and slightly grilled fresh pita slices were all outstanding!!!  I have loved Greco Fresh food once or twice a week (generally for my "gyro fix:") for years and now I also highly recommend you try Greco Fresh Grille catering for your parties.   You can thank me later!!!! ;-)

lsMeKiWVYtsXUf_azC9kuQ.text: Good food as always but food was a little saltier than before. For the lamb combo platter, salad that came with was fresh but salty. Spinach pie, dolmas and hummus platter was good. Both falafel platter and skewered chicken kebob were tasty.  The special dessert(forgot the long name of it) was so yummy, s dessert pastry with egg custard cream. Spacious outdoor seating available!

Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

DkAaZeB2-irO6hAVOj05CQ.text: I love this place. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The first time I came in the place was packed! so that's a great sign. Its not fine dining but if youre looking for fast delicious Greek food this is the place. Great for lunch breaks during the week.

1i9AMB0VPuqWuknPD8Ol_A.text: Had been seeing reviews on this place & since I moved close by I wanted to try them out & they didn't disappoint. A little on the expensive side but the food is so amazing! I loved the lemon oregano fries! I had the platter

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

OjQZuo4SFUwCi4UyzDt2QA.text: Delicious Lamb gyros! I wish they automatically put romaine lettuce on them.  They put feta on it but not romaine lettuce which most place is vice versa.  The lamb is super tender and seasoned well.  The oregano and cumin french fry seasoning is good.  The lemon and garlic fry juice is tasty and bring out ketchup well.  Conveniently located in a shopping center.  My second drop in and it's consistently good. Love the sweet tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Highly seasoned lamb!

_PnKoMyHMqTmGQMageD9yQ.text: They have excellent customer service and really authentic tasting food. I have enjoyed everything I have tried. I am already a regular after 2 visits, every weekend I have to stop in. Keep up the amazing work. I hope they get on postmates so I enjoy it during the week as well.

OJYfevBwnE8v7top8KOXZA.text: The Lamb Gyro is the best I've ever had.  The meat has so much flavor and is seasoned so well.  The Tzaziki sauce is truly authentic tasting.  I have never been to Greece but I have a good friend who is from Greece and even she agreed that it was very authentic.  The fried are good.  I personally prefer the lemon Oregano but I've heard good things about the Cumin ones too.  The nicest part is seeing the owner in there hands on working hard to make his business a success.

eFzeFHqyICBIp4TOugy8eQ.text: On a return visit, my husband had their Gyro, and said it was one of the best he's ever had.  I had their shrimp pita....OMGsh!!!  It was SO good!

5yHPExPtZWe2tvwtYdXOZA.text: Recently visited for the first time.  Food was wonderful and the Tzatziki sauce spot on!

ezV-GATl6GQKtV528Tat5A.text: Favorite place for lunch, wonderful family owned restaurant, great gyro's and the garlic cumin fries are to die for. Hummus is made fresh daily, this is a can't miss!

KQKHDVtm7a42f8bhJ-wobg.text: My wife and I decided to try Greco's for the first time and it was delicious. The smell when we walked in was divine. The gentleman behind the counter was so nice that he made us feel like we were his family walking into his home. He checked up on us as well and had a deep love for his food (which I love to see). The food was perfectly prepared and amazing!! Will definitely come back again and again!

ZsvjMG-FnHEu4hupP7Zyjg.text: This was one of the best places I have ever eaten ... The people were so nice and good was so great will be a life long customer ...

Y4sXHCxSm_tnTpSRUNLLFg.text: Everything here is delicious - very flavorful and fresh. The tzatziki sauce here is my favorite so far, and I normally order it on the side with my food even if my dish doesn't come with it. You'll also find friendly employees who keep a clean restaurant which is key in a place like this since it stays pretty busy! The lemon oregano fries are amazing and go great with the gyros. This place is  definitely my favorite Greek restaurant in the area and I'm happy they're expanding towards the South Park area!

UdXLSDhud0WAMIkI4dK0eg.text: I LOVE this place.  My family gets take out from here a lot.  I usually get the Greek salad with grilled chicken.  It's not a boring old salad.  The chicken is delicious and there's also feta, greek olives, cucumber, tomato, really good dressing, and pita wedges.  My husband opts for the lamb gyro which is delicious.  Their garlic and cumin fries are out of this world and an order is definitely large enough to share.  The staff are super friendly.  It's also a nice place to eat if you want to grab a quick bite and eat outside while shopping at Blakeney.

yrxp48ch02RgNfEDLYe1cA.text: Really solid spot for casual Greek in Blakeney.  I've tried both the chicken and lamb gyros, and both are quite yummy.  I appreciate having the option for whole wheat pita, even with the 25 cent upcharge.  Have tried both types of fries, lemon oregano and garlic cumin, and while they're sure to make any fry lover happy, I didn't find them particularly spectacular.  I prefer to opt for their hummus, with an interesting rotation of flavors, having tried the chipotle hummus which was good.  Prices are very reasonable, with pitas going for $6, with an extra $3 to make it a combo with fries or hummus and a drink.  Highly recommend for a quick lunch if you find yourself in the area.

Pyf7QTaOpvJSfoHhvjn78Q.text: The best place for gyro.I am so addicted to the veggie gyro. I wish this place is next to the place I work. I would go at least three time a week. Everything is great at this place.

ilGOoxWLCdT7mosm0mCAbQ.text: I asked the cashier for recommendation as this was my first time here.  Lamb gyro was good, but i should have skipped the lemon seasoned fries - they were cold.  I will come back another time and reevaluate my 3-star grade.

KOB8dm_wJ7anlMID_XGj4w.text: Lemon and oregano fries are amazing. Who knew? I also had the chicken gyro. That was good but not as overwhelming as the fries.  Really attentive staff. Highly recommend this place for anyone in south Charlotte.

dMhM7R0r4uZJFzgBh4tD1w.text: The lamb gyro is the best I've ever had.  Their Greek burger is amazing as well!!  The burger comes on great bread - not a bun, and it's excellent.  It comes with lettuce, onions, and tomato on it.  The platter with fries and a drink is definitely the way to go here!

jA4C-wb58bTkVbKp1tgzGg.text: Greco Fresh Grille is great. We always walked by and considered trying it out but never did until a friend told me they serve the best gyros she's ever had. Great recommendation! We love this place now. I always order a gyro, either chicken or falafel. The chicken is delicious, very simply prepared with tzatziki, tomato, lettuce and red onions, but still flavorful. The falafel is good, too. Sometimes a bit under-seasoned, but still good. My husband prefers the burger. It's seasoned well and you can add American, mozzarella or feta cheese. They have seasoned french fries, too. We like them all: lemon-oregano, cumin and garlic and, plain with sea salt. Their hummus is delicious too. The flavors change weekly, my favorite is probably the rosemary hummus. The restaurant itself is small but comfortable. It's in a great location within Blakeney. The staff is awesome. They're so nice and you can tell they take pride in what they do. Greco Fresh Grille is a great, quick Mediterranean restaurant.

P1NxQi-BZCqMGKDyX3FKdw.text: A great family restaurant. The food was excellent and had great prices. The chicken gyro was delicious as well as the choices of hummus.....

IUooNNO2uRiegy5sXPcIJA.text: Our favorite restaurant in Charlotte!Amazing and inexpensive! The chicken is so good and delicious. Great gyros. You can't go wrong or over order.

H89Gp_9swLYeVUDf0UpHaA.text: This is located in the Blakeney shopping center. Ordered the chicken gyro combo, comes with drink and fries for $2.75 more, I think. The gyro is always packed with chicken and really flavorful with the tzatziki sauce. I get the lemon and oregano fries; also yummy. Nice people, good food at a reasonable price.

vgKXsYk0yfVfINT5dH2rBQ.text: Yay for Yelp! Was looking for a reasonably priced non-chain and Yelp told me to go here. I did what most of you suggested and got the simple lam gyro and lemon oregano fries combo. About $10 for the combo, which was a little more than I wanted to spend, but it was delicious. The tzatziki sauce with the fries were SO GOOD. Definitely homemade sauce. The gyro tasted really fresh and the lamb was obviously cooked fresh too. I personally like a little feta on my gyro, but that's alright...it may not be traditional Greek to have feta. Nevertheless, high recommended! Will go back soon for sure!

H_u2Zv4rwb3MwEjN2NDuUQ.text: Very convenient to my home and work. I am Greek and was so excited to see this open up. The food was good... except I was upset that the teenage girl behind the counter told me the baklava was homemade... my whole family was disappointed with the obviously store boughten baklava. I would've preferred that she told me the truth so I didn't waste my money. I'll probably be back one day...., but not for the baklava.

A1AWfNDHJ0ToR3pR4PgvsA.text: Wonderful fresh ingredients in this family run business. Their love of what they serve and the passion in which they serve it is great. The food is casual, wonderful and reasonably priced! Delicious!

4P5Gel8bpzTb1IDYooJqHQ.text: Stopped here wanting a REAL gyro. So the husband & I met in this tight congested shopping center & walked in this nicely decorated eatery. There is a crisp decor & not overly done.  The staff is very friendly & helpful. There is a large menu hanging over the open kitchen area. A long counter in front of the cooking are does have s few stools to sit & eat or maybe wait for your take out order.  The are several small tables & seems to have a nice patio out back that would be a great place for a group.  At the end of the counter is where you order so after standing & looking up for several minutes we proceed to the register & order lamb gyros & make it a combo for $2.50 for, which gave us a drink & fries. We choose the lemon & oregano fried just for a change of pace!   We were given our paper drink cups & a number & found a table placed the number card in the stand & waited for just a little bit. Soon a girl brings our meals that are served in plastic diner basket with wax paper lining it. Gave us real silverware wrapped in a napkin.  opened up my gyro and my eyes just were so very wide looking at the massive amount shoved in this pita bread. ive never been given to much meat in one of these before! it was 2 slices (not super thin either!) nicely cooked with just a hint of pink in the center. Tzatziki  sauce fresh and placed on the bottom then a lot of sliced purple onion, some tomato slices and topped with that meat. the fries were really good, I didnt detect the lemon but hubs said he could sometimes. but the oregano was really nice. served with a small solo cup of ketchup. I think next time I might get some Tzatziki  sauce to dip them in!~  The drinks are a fill it yourself, so if eating in this is nice since you can fill er up before you leave. They had 2 tea urns, but i didnt see which was sweet and which was unsweet so I just went with soda.  my only negatives are that it was a little loud, people trying to talk over the loud greek radio type music/talking over head. also I found it really weird that neither my hubs or myself could get a cell signal in here! (AT&T). strange! we had to check in on yelp once we were done and walked outside.

EnreF9b1cdN3itYK668qog.text: The food has sadly Americanized, too much success too soon? I've been back a few times  - not as often as I'd like because 22 miles is a long round trip for a Gyro - the fun has been going down but today, finally was just a big disappointing.   They no longer offer the delicious Melitzonasalata, I was told because locals are not interested. Galaktompureko sorry no we don't have any, I didn't see any spinach pie ... it's pretty much down to people lining up for Gyro and "Greek" fries.   Even the gyro (which is still good) is not what it used to be - more grease, less flavor ... is that pressed lamb meat? Not the same.  I brought home the Lahano salad, which turned out to be nothing but shredded cabbage with a tiny bit of Arugula, essentially $7 for a plate of slaw. Studying the menu after the fact I see I was supposed to spend an  additional $3-$4 for chicken or some other protein on top, Greek salad? I think not.    If enough people notice maybe the owners will raise their standards but I won't be holding my breath.

DHRQgsYKdWQUggXM4LdjYg.text: Delicious!!!! We had the traditional gyro's and lemon oregano fries. For dessert we had their baklava. All of it...the bomb dot com. Coming from a Greek food lover. :)

3YqqnPNVpne4yn-hrn4PWA.text: Such tasty green gyros and produce for toppings.  Love the gyro with Garlic fries.  Must visit in bLakeney  area.

2zOjqgy0Q7t4NVeqVTEl5Q.text: Absolutely the best Gyro you can get around! Coming from New Jersey, I've tried many Greek places in the NY/NJ area. Never have I tried a place as authentic and as delicious as Greco Fresh Grille! Employees are friendly, place looks great, and food is the best! I had the lamb gyro, Greek fries, lemon rosemary hummus, and peasant salad. All fantastic choices! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb Gyro, Greek fries, Peasant Greek Salad, and rosemary lemon hummus. All delicious!

ZXgw8EYJWAZD882QjY0zpg.text: Amazing everything.  I have never been disappointed or left feeling hungry.  Great food, nice staff, always a pleasure.   Also....REALLY Good food.

99tXyCy0wiDU5yCuNZWZ5g.text: This place is a hidden gem! Love the chick pea salad with salmon! Arugula is fresh and the tastiest lemon dressing. Oh! the fries with rosemary and lemon are to die for. We are there at least once a week if not more! My favorite restaurant at Blakeney.

rtOcK8soguxgx2ui3mGY4g.text: I have been coming to this restaurant for about a year now and am just getting around to writing a review.  I absolutely love their food and the people who work here are just so warm and friendly.  You really feel welcome when you walk in the door.  I have introduced several people that I work with to this restaurant and everyone who I have brought just raves about the food.  I always get their Greek salad with grilled chicken and it is so good.  My husband loves the gyro and their fries are awesome.  I wish they were closer to my work so I could come more often!

wACMmA-gneGwqvJukKA59g.text: Always good food and excellent service.  They really care about their customers and go the extra mile.  Love the falafel, lemon Basil frys, and gyro.  All their food is awesome and fresh!

abJ1SFlzmBBtY7Ja6e4xxg.text: I'll go ahead and reiterate what everyone has already said, this place is fantastic. There isn't anything I can even think of to nitpick, their ingredients are fresh, consistent, and certainly filling.   The gyros are awesome, the lamb is juicy and well seasoned, the tzatziki is creamy, and the onions are nice and crisp. The baklava is fresh and flaky as well. As good as their sandwiches are, the fries are even better. Probably top five I've ever had, and some of the best seasoned. I've ordered a couple orders of their fries in different flavors for parties and it's always a crowd-pleaser. In a neighborhood full of choices to eat, this is one of favorites in Blakeney/Stonecrest area.

agkwm-6IsAVfa6Ow4kuoYw.text: YUM!  Fresh is indeed the word for this place, what a delightful stop for a quick dinner.  The owner asked if it was my first time, how I had heard about them, etc. and I told him that I had seen some glowing reviews on Yelp and had to try it out for myself.  He laughed and said when the Yelpers like you, you're in good and when they don't it's not good.  :)  Such a charmer, excellent first impression, but I had to try the food.  As the other reviews have stated, Greco Fresh Grille is located at Blakeney along the restaurant row portion on the far end.  Parking - meh.  Directly in front of the restaurant is 15 minute parking, so swing on past that towards Bath and Body and Wells Fargo and you should have some luck.  At 5:30 on a Monday, I was a little ahead of the dinner rush, but as I was finishing, folks started to pour in.  I am glad I got there early, as I got a chance to speak with the owner.    The food: Grilled chicken gyro:  well seasoned white meat served on a warm pita with tzatziki (totally had to look that up) sauce, thinly sliced onions and tomatoes.  Delish!  It tasted bright and fresh, very good.   The fries:  I ordered the lemon with oregano fries (the owner said if you are getting fries to go, the plain or garlic/cumin is suggested as the lemon that is tossed with the fries can make them a tad soggy if you aren't going to eat them soon).  I liked them - different, tasty.  But he was kind enough to send over a sample of the garlic/cumin fries and they were AWESOME.  I like crispy (burned) fries, and these were perfect.  Lightly seasoned and such a tasty change from plain old salt.  Quite good! As Ben stated, they have the Pepsi (sigh), but they do have Cheerwine - YAY!  Awesome Greek music playing, but not loud or obtrusive at all.  If I had any friends to eat with, we could have easily carried on a conversation.  There is a TV that was on the Cooking channel when I was in with subtitles.    Friendly tip - your breath is going to be WHEEEEYEW from all of the deliciousness, so I wouldn't do this for a first date (or third, *wink*) or before a trip to your dentist (unless you hate your dentist), but any other time would be fabulous.  Great little spot, the owner and his staff are incredible and definitely made a great impression.  Come for the friendliness, stay for the food, I can't wait to go back and try some more food.

clomDmIq5mAIgdjVu51ZYg.text: Simple Menu!  All the Meats and the Tzatziki are Exceptional!  The Pita Bread is Amazing!  This is my Favorite Greek and Favorite place for a Wrap!  First I had the Lamb Gyro and Fries.  The Gyro was Fantastic - Great Pita Bread, Red Onion, No lettuce (nice touch), Tomato and Tzatziki!  They have an "Open Kitchen" which I think always puts the customers at ease!  The fries are not what I like, (I'm real picky about fries, if you see my very short "Fries" list) and what does it matter, though they are fresh (Not frozen)!  The Salad dressing was good, not great (I'm very picky about EVERYTHING!!!)!  Then I had the Chicken Gyro with two sides of Tzatziki. Excellent!  The music was soft Greek sounding, relaxing, great dining music!  The Decor is Greek: Blue and White.  Very comfortable environment!  The service was Outstanding!  Superb!  Top Notch!!! Fast and Friendly!  Had lunch there today and they were busy and handling it with Skill!!!

4zZccYleBHy0nvO2zfgJyQ.text: Great service and AMAZING food!! I discovered this place about a month ago and we eat there at least twice a week! Everything on their menu is delicious and fresh! 5stars!!

ehfIsCBWcOPRgLMFyfTlFQ.text: Well, I decided to give this another shot. I came in for lunch and went with a gyro and oregano fries. I was much more impressed this time. I felt the quality of the food was much more in line with what I was paying, and if I recall correctly, the inside of the restaurant has been improved. The oregano fries are a nice change, but I do think they go a tad heavy on the oregano. I thought the service was much better this go around. After my visit, I feel like I'll come back to this place more frequently.

8cUb9dsFzIrg7JI0NO4u2w.text: The best french fries in Charlotte.  Period.  These are delicious fresh cut seasoned fries that are french fry perfection.  I have had the lemon & oregano and the cumin & garlic and both are excellent.  I enjoy the shrimp pita and the veggie pita.  Both have creamy delicious sauce and fresh purple onion slices wrapped in a warm soft pita bread wrap.  Employees are friendly and helpful.

6HUqOz38nCIh4g0UKzbj7Q.text: Authentic Greek restaurant! Very friendly staff and consistently good food.  Definitely one of the best fast-food like greek restaurants in the Charlotte area. Been there three times so far and loved it every single time.  They have outside seating as well.

l90SxBT9CpyHxCBJiFxfmQ.text: Fast food atmosphere - but quite possible one of the BEST Greek Gyros in all of South Charlotte. The owner is authentic Greek descandant and they were playing Greek radio (Pandora) while we ate.   Very authentic, and large, generous portions of sliced meat.

6UPS3G6lPrEDxCBPArSaJA.text: The chicken gyro was awesome! The chicken is seasoned to perfection, with thinly sliced onions, tomatoes, tzatziki on a warm gyro! I chose a side salad which was just as great, lettuce, tomatoes, olives, feta, onions & an amazing homemade dressing! Love it!!!

tJemLyFXZxCBF6zDsSrANg.text: Cool, quick and good eat! The lemon parsley fries are a must have. The shrimp pita was fresh and delish! The tzatziki sauce was a little much...may ask for little next time. Greek salad was just that...nothing more and nothing less. Local fav!

photos.caption: Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

nS5kLgSMXAS2VSm19sf0Yw.text: Great food and friendly people. We've tried just about everything on the menu.  The lemon fries are tasty and the salads are always fresh.  The chicken on the pita is usually a little dry, like it is warmed over, but tasty.  We eat here every few weeks.  We also get takeout from time to time and the serving is always generous.  Nice to also sit outside in the back when the weather is nice.

6ZlQRvKCJNztThbvH-qL7g.text: I thought I got a Greek platter with a peasant salad to go. I actually got just the gyro meat, cucumber and tomato salad and seasoned fries instead. They definitely up charged for what I ordered and I have no idea what went wrong. The meat was seasoned well and juicy but nothing amazing. I'm pleased my tomatoes were properly ripe - nobody likes a soggy tomato. The fries had a fantastic cumin flavor that wasn't too heavy but the fries themselves were maybe overcooked? Bleh. I also got grape leaves. The filling was perfect but a little heavy on the lemon.  Overall the food I got (not ordered) was average and close-ish to authentic flavors. I'd have to eat in next time in case my order needs correcting again.

e5uiwBxZ67jmtn-7lPSfTA.text: Lemon-oregano fries! Their fries are our favorite fries in Charlotte! But eat them there, they'll get soggy if you try to take them with you. Love the gyros too. Next time I'm trying the lamb burger.

J_mvVKdl7Ep46F0_7r9PiQ.text: I was so disappointed after reading reviews.  We ordered a gyro wich was good but the french fries were super soggy and oily.  The salad was so slappy cut huge and had 3 little squares of feta cheese then the grilled chicken I added to it was gummy like they microwaved after was grilled and sitting there. It was pretty gross dry and chewy.

snrAzNy2rvmkU6u2sciX1w.text: Finally ventured into this little Blakeney gem. My wife had been before and had great things to say so, needless to say, we were long overdue.   Resting amongst more attractive and simple options for suburban folk, I'm happy to say Greco Fresh Grille is local-biz lover's haven.   Small, shotgun setup on the inside and a handful of tables out back. The outdoor seating is great, but goes quite fast if it's a nice day. Get at it quick! Always nice to see filled tables at an off hour. Telltale sign this place is doing something right.   Friendly service behind the counter. Welcoming and helpful.   Here's our order:   Got cups for water. They have pepsi products. (No hard feelings. I'm just a coke guy through and through. I'll make an exception for Cheerwine, however. Viva NC)  Spinach Pie. To the Greek-savvy, Spanakopita. Amazing. The phyllo is perfectly crispy, flaky and crunches/dissolves with each bite. The spinach filling is savory and not too rich and creamy. Comes with 6 pieces, so perfect for a table of two. If you're sharing with more than two, you'll have to fight for more than one piece! I'd get this every time.   My wife got the veggie gyro. Great mix of roasted red peppers, cucumber, red onion and great tzatziki. I'm a fan. The pita is thick and chewy, but not offensively so. I'd be hard pressed to shove a few pieces of the spinach pie in this bad boy! Loved all of the textures and flavors. Not overpowering and a great veggie option.   I got the lamp gyro. Voted best in the QC by the Observer. I say rightfully so. Generous helping of lamb, balanced well with fresh veggies and, yet again, a nice slather of that great tzatziki. Each bite was great and I was only disappointed once it was gone.   Prices are very reasonable. We ate for $20 and were happily full!  Parking can be an issue, as there aren't many spaces directly in front of the shop. Not uncommon for Blakeney spots. I'd park over near the Starbucks.   Can't wait to head back and stuff my face with more Greek food. Opa!  Cheers.

Photo of Greco Fresh Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb gyro

ngTTJHB01q4To1igs6SBSA.text: I come for the fries. Some of the best pub style fries in Charlotte. Different hummus every day. Generous portions. WiFi is password protected but they'll happily give you the current password at the register.

UDQBMD4_BlcK4xTPQEr99Q.text: Very very good GREEK restaurant and owner is from Greece so knows how it should really taste without the typical pure grease gyros you get at other places. This isn't a fair ground this is great quality GREEK food. Love it - the aura of the place is great too very clean and love the music playing! Five stars!

W5vid5tuUOPBD2vQuBnMwA.text: 5.95 for a gyro? I'll have like four please.. to feed myself.  Greco isn't the most high-end, upscale restaurant on the inside, but you really shouldn't judge this little book by its cover.  The food and service is definitely A+.   The food at Greco is cheap cheap cheap but doesn't taste like it at all.  The best part of the meal is paying 3.00$ extra for Lemon-Oregano fries and a drink.  Getting an entree + fries + drink is a little too much food for just one person honestly so if you're looking to just be 'full' when you leave instead of 'super stuffed', maybe share the fries with a friend?    Lastly, they have baklava that's the size of my entire hand.  The baklava I've had before was the same price and literally the size of a quarter (but I kept paying for it because it was sooooo good).  Thank goodness I've found a better alternative in this wonderful little place.

0RJ-6vf_-Clea5If76pCjg.text: The service is fantastic! The food cooked freshly as you order and are prepared quickly. I tried the lamb gyro and my friend tried the veggie gyro, both are amazing! This is one of the best mediterranean restaurant I've been to! If anyone has tried their stuffed grape leaves or the orange phyllo dessert let us know how it is!

-Z57bj6HX56mmKRhDJDEYA.text: Love the lemon oregano fries!!! The gyros are pretty good they just don't give as much meat as the competition thus the 4 stars.

3ue8T66tbxV3e5a4iSu4rA.text: So good I visited the Wesley Chapel location too.  The Ballantyne location is a little hole in the wall next to Coldstone.  Oh is it tasty.  Just great salad w/that olive oil pinch of salt & traditional gyro all the way.  We've been back 2x in the last week.

cZ14wrHLDyISZ88ZMgV3Dw.text: This is the best Greek restaurant ever the staff is so nice and the food is the best Greek food I've ever had! You NEED to come to greco fresh grille blakeney

q9ihxRpSfEPNq3VUMgRvnw.text: I've eaten both take out and eaten in at this cute little hole in the wall Greek restaurant.  I am so very impressed at the freshness of everything and the flavors are to die for. I've never been a fan of dolmades anywhere else as they are usually slimy and tasteless.  I'm proud to say that they have completely and totally changed my mind!  Lemony and firm and beautiful.  Gyros and hummus are home made and beautifully presented.  The tzatziki is freshly made and has the right amount of garlic.  This is hands down my favorite Greek place!

PZc74id1hpmqBapy3_o6BA.text: I was somewhat saving this for my 200th review as I wanted it to be a write-up about something good.  Greco's Fresh Grill in the Blakeney area near Rea Rd and Ardrey Kell Roads is one of the best places in the area to go for fresh, quick, and reasonably priced, mostly authentic Greek food.    It is counter service.  Peruse the menu above the grills and sneezeguards, then order what you'd like and they'll bring it to your table. Lamb gyros, chicken gyros, vegetarian stuffed grape leaves, lemon oregano fries, etc..  I have had the chicken gyro, the plain hummus, and the lemon oregano fries.  The gyro is delicious; they do not skimp on the chicken, and there is a lot of seasoning and oil on it.  Do NOT remove it from the foil lest you would like oil dripping all over you.  The hummus is probably the best I have had around here.  It's very fresh and there are no fillers in it.  The menu states "If it's harder to pronounce than a Greek last name, then you shouldn't be eating it.".  The lemon oregano fries are decent.  They are not necessarily my flavor preference, but they are good for what they are.  The people working, from the Greek cooks/owners, to the teenage girls usually running the register, are all very friendly.  So if you want a good, fresh gyro at a fair price in south Charlotte, Greco's is the place to go.

lwpiAqTFxcoMmWzTETQZ3Q.text: I have been eating at Greco regularly for 3 years now and have been delighted during each visit. My kids loooove their chicken skewers with the tasting Greek seasoning. (They beg me to take them there). You can't leave without indulging in the lemon oregano fries. I dare to say they are the best fries in the state! Only get one order for the table though; as the portion is ample and you WILL clean your plate. The tzatiki is so creamy and light...I always get extras. Mmmmmm, I am hungry remembering the lamb burger on pita; wow...I call that happiness on a plate. Greek salad and shrimp pita are just some of my other favorites. Oh, I almost forgot the prices are so reasonable for the quality and if you want extra tzatiki, they don't nickel and dime you; they happily give you more with a smile. And they are family owned; very nice people. Gotta go; I need me some Greco love.

AhVApDDWRetaUbRjgYjYXw.text: Deliciously prepared! Service was prompt and courteous. I would highly recommend this for fresh Greek food!

QUE-ZvKPmxklqWBkdmYdHQ.text: Went to Greco for a quick lunch after school today. Walking in, you notice the sleek decor paired with older Greek decorations. It's an interesting vibe they create, but they pull it off pretty well. I ordered the grilled chicken gyro. We sat outside, and our food was out in about ten minutes. My chicken was very very good. Fresh, and not chewy at all. Probably some of the best chicken I've had. The tzatziki was fresh and delicious, and the onions and tomatoes complimented the whole thing. The pita was also very good.  Service was fine, really not enough interaction to judge anything. Overall, if I was in a bind for time, I'd go again!

BlGZXoIve1Hq9YeyVi4r2w.text: Employees are friendly and helpful so that's good.   However, I have had A LOT of Mediterranean food in my life, and this place falls short of the other comparable food taste I have experienced. Although everything is fresh and hot, the taste is not that flavorful and the portion sizes are smaller than other Mediterranean places I have been to like Kabob Grill, Troy or La Shish.    I have friends that are Arab and from the Mediterranean region so I know this cuisine pretty well, and I can say that I don't find the taste to be as authentic as my friends foods that I have had or other restaurant places I have tried.   I'm not saying the place is bad, just not great.

6eB8X47HVnqEXL4lGJnH_w.text: It was just ok. Very skimpy with meat portions. Daughter got shrimp platter, I got chicken platter and hubby got lamb platter. Greek salad was disappointing. Feta cheese was terrible. Consistency of tofu with feta flavoring.  Green peppers in Greek salad?  Never!!!!  But they did. Lamb was gristly and chicken was dry. Shrimp was good but overall meat portions very small for the hefty price. Won't go back.

KB3V0tooXx0BX2TfZe2Iag.text: Another update on Greco Fresh Grille as they've been open now for about six months. We stopped by last Saturday around 3PM and the place was hopping. Great to see they're doing such a brisk business.  They've added a few new items to their decor, and a few new specials to their menu. Pastitsio was listed as a special with the description of "Greek Lasagne" - sounded good but I was there for the gyro and fries.   The food was great, but I wish they'd offer a combo with side items other than fries. Perhaps some hummus or a small greek salad. It's so easy to go there and get a gyro and fries, and then leave feeling like you've eaten something as heavy as 5 Guys next door.  The owner is there every time I visit, and he stopped by to check on how things were going. This is still a winner of a place to me. It's exactly what I'd hoped for when they opened.

0DjmxeTX2YxT7HBHXwOtvg.text: Had a hard time finding it in the large shopping area but were successful at last.   Greco is a very small restaurant but the additional outdoor seating helps.  You order with the cashier and they bring your food to the table.  My husband had the gyro platter and I had the lamb burger.  Everything was hot and fresh.  We were very happy with our meals and will definitely return whenever we are in the area.
